tweets.text: Field Teams continue to carry out refuelling of our High Volume Pumps across the @EnvAgencyYNE area this weekend. 6” pumps, like the one pictured here, weigh 2900kg & can pump 125 litres of water per second. That’s 5.5 hours to empty an olympic size swimming pool! #TeamEA https://t.co/dKlf4Bk41r

U.K. Floods

Over 40 tonnes of sand so far and over 1500 sandbags supplied in total

tweets.text: Huge pressure on our river systems at present and more rain on the way. This is the River Hull in East Yorkshire filmed 24 hrs ago by @joecameraman highest water levels since records began #flooding #climatechange #drones #environment https://t.co/j4UDHz5pqM

The Rive Anchomlme at Bishopbridge, Browns Bridge and Brandy Wharf looking rather full this afternoon and no doubt will rise further this evening. @EnvAgency @ShireGroupIDBs @BorrillRobert @ADA_updates @dbirch214 https://t.co/ep2IYPctH3

Hi @KeepBristolTidy see below @BristolCouncil contractors tarmaced over drains, how did they get away with this please @BristolCouncil, wasn't there an inspiration of works before paying contractors? https://t.co/0581aR2Q5I

@qwag @chinbrookmeadow @EnvAgencySE Looks like levels are starting to fall...

https://t.co/zFsGzl74Vc

We’ve issued a number of  wide Flood Alerts and #FloodWarnings across #Yorkshire
 
We’re  closely monitoring the situation and will be working through the night to keep communities safe.
 
For the latest info, visit https://t.co/OVBXgMyngb https://t.co/ZdQsUU2ieA

urls.title: Flood warnings for England - GOV.UK
urls.description: Check your risk of flooding: get current flood warnings, river and sea levels, check the 5-day forecast or use flood risk maps

tweets.text:
River levels are responding to this morning’s persistent rainfall. 

Flood Warnings have been issued for:

- River Spen in the Liversedge & Cleckheaton 
- River Aire at Allerton Ings
- Tyersal and Pudsey Beck 
- Hebble Brook in Halifax

Act Now 

https://t.co/KxbDaZynmP https://t.co/gS9wGN5PyM

tweets.text: Lots of surface water from the heavy rain across Leeds causing difficulties on roads. Our teams busy dealing with clearing it while also on standby in case of snow. We should all be making only essential journeys due to lockdown, but if you must go out take care. #StormDarcy 1/3 https://t.co/q2sOaQb006
Perhaps a very large fine? @EnvAgencyAnglia @EnvAgency Or chalkstreams don't matter and it's OK to destroy them? @theriverstrust @N_Rivers_Trust https://t.co/Z6GovpQC1y

tweets.text: This is terrible, @pow_rebecca @EmmaHowardBoyd @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @TonyJuniper and, across England EA and NE is simply failing to get a grip of river pollution. So much has gone wrong since 2010. https://t.co/Avn1GXn96K

This needs investigating ASAP ! 
Not only badger sets but a massive range of wildlife have and are being effected at the Hayle Harbour Development’s by Simon Wright ( Corinthianhomes ) with illegal disturbance and removal of these animals ! @JeffReines @Natures_Voice @EIA_News

So this is the current state of the pig arcs at Congham, no pigs have gone as far as we can tell, a number are due to farrow any day, is this the right way to farm pigs? @NFUCountryside @RSPCA_Frontline @RussellB1ggs @EnvAgency @EDP24 @KingsLynnNews24 https://t.co/AC3QN66AsG

Due to continuing rainfall there are a number of Flood Alerts and Flood Warnings in place for #WestYorkshire. 

For the latest situation visit https://t.co/KxbDaZynmP

Check your flood risk and sign up to free flood warnings #FloodAware https://t.co/Usf4TfZvOt

Surface water #flooding is possible across parts of Yorkshire due to rain falling on saturated ground. 

Stay safe and don’t walk or drive through flood water. 

For guidance on #SurfaceWaterFlooding in your area, contact your local authority.

#FloodAware https://t.co/ObX36kA0GB

Relieved that water levels in South Hinksey are now falling. Pumps and barriers remain for a while to keep homes dry. Amazing effort by local residents and @EnvAgencySE to keep people safe...and some lessons learnt that @LaylaMoran and I will feedback to the EA and Thames Water https://t.co/rRfxEp4fjH
@CotsLifeEditor @GlosHeritageHub @SevernUnlocked @CanalRiverTrust @EnvAgencyMids @NaturalEngland @gloswaterways @elverdave How can I hear that?
@CotsLifeEditor @GlosHeritageHub @SevernUnlocked @CanalRiverTrust @EnvAgencyMids @NaturalEngland @gloswaterways @elverdave Awww my dads voice!! Hartley Everett! ❤

This is disgusting and someone needs to be held account now ! It has been found that Hayle Harbour development has illegally disturbed badger sets and are under investigation! Finally some hope ! We need answers now, wildlife experts need to get involved ASAP. !

All in a days work for a flood warden in the Calder Valley,  the best bit for me and @adrianandkim the biccies and tea from @Fleurdelyshb 😊 glad we managed to keep your mum dry Claudette 👌🏼 #floodaware @EnvAgencyYNE @Calderdale https://t.co/wDkUavJnPz
@dickiewood @EnvAgencyYNE It's clear at the minute, but only just. That was last week.

tweets.text: More fun today diving into River #Severn docs at @GlosHeritageHub as part of @SevernUnlocked project. Good to hear Hartley Everett's voice again after so many years (MiniDisc), talking about eel and salmon fishing. Next up, Jasper Ely (pics below by me, Darrell Arms, Dec '85). https://t.co/jt2Pi69wdh
@SimonTemplarGB @EnvAgencyYNE Oy vey! You need a rib not a car!
@EnvAgencyYNE @dickiewood Again... https://t.co/QIslpA1PTg

tweets.text: Residents should stay alert and check flood warnings regularly. You can check your area here https://t.co/PhaiEsZrkk and you can also follow @EnvAgencyYNE on Twitter
This modelling accounts for some but perhaps not all flood defence schemes, however at the current rate of @EnvAgency spend... 🤔 https://t.co/qOvLvsy5KT

A Flood Warning has been issued for Scarborough North Bay. 

Please stay away from seafront areas as strong onshore winds, large waves and sea spray are dangerous. 

For more details visit :
https://t.co/OBc9BCdrI3

#FloodAware https://t.co/JuhIdTqhff

Anyone traveling along the A631 tonight needs to take care at Bishopbridge as flood water from the Rase is starting to come onto the road. Nearly half way across in one place. If it rises much more it will start running across. @LincsRuralCrime @LincsPolice @EnvAgency

A groundwater flood alert has been issued for east Kent.

We are working extremely closely with the @EnvAgencySE @Kent_cc and @SouthernWater to tackle any problems that might come our way.

Full update: https://t.co/WmmGJa33p2 https://t.co/To6JzCRZyA

Our teams are out on the ground and will be monitoring the situation closely throughout the night and into tomorrow - we have plans in place based on areas which have flooded before so please don’t call us for sandbags.

@RobGMacfarlane My Amsterdam correspondent tells me the locks have been closed today to give the canals the best chance of freezing over in the coming week of hard frosts. Rare event these days, but important in Dutch culture.

tweets.text: On shifts this weekend with @EnvAgencyAnglia for storm Darcy but I can still daydream about rowing on the Colne with @Wivgigs (thanks Nel for this morning's 'calm before the storm' photo 🙂) https://t.co/dYU7Qod1sI

Glimpse at why we have a nitrate disaster in the #solent & why our #chalkstreams are in unfavourable condition. Monks Brook, a trib of the #riveritchen rises on thin soils, peppered with maize & other cultivated uses. No proper riparian buffers #publicgoods being washed away https://t.co/WcO70WGK5m
@woldengineering @CraigNewton10 @EnvAgency @WildTroutTrust Tractor porn! 🤣🤣🤣
